intro: Harpullia blancoi, commonly known as the white harpullia, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
